comments.body: Promise.config is assigned a function that contains a whole bunch of non top-level `Promise.prototype.method` assignments. So we don't treat a bunch of methods as constructor functions, same as the other projects in this PR.

diffHunk:

node_modules/bluebird/js/release/debuggability.js(482,42): error TS2339: Property '_peekContext' does not exist on type 'longStackTracesCaptureStackTrace'.

comments.body: @weswigham this capture of a union of parameter lists in `apply` seems related to the named tuple change. I think it's a regression, but not a bad one unless it's indicative of a worse problem. Can you investigate more?

comments.body: previously, we weren't using isJSConstructor to detect constructor functions, just this-prototype assignment. Now have an assigned prototype (`FakeConstructor.prototype = {}`) is enough.

comments.body: Seems likely to be a change in bluebird. Need to confirm.
No, this appears to be different narrowing behaviour. The errors are correct as far as they go; we can't track the side-effecting-module style that bluebird uses.
